column2: Taiwan govt asks foreign investors to support bid to control Chang Hwa bank TAIPEI
column3: Dec 2 Taiwan's finance ministry is urging foreign investors to elect its representatives to the board of Chang Hwa Commercial Bank Ltd as it seeks to wrest control of the mid-sized lender from Taishin Financial Holding.

column2: UPDATE 4-Design flaws led to 2013 lithium-ion battery fire in Boeing 787 -U.S. NTSB WASHINGTON
column3: Dec 1 A lithium-ion battery that caught fire aboard a parked Boeing 787 in 2013 in Boston had design flaws and it should not have been certified by the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration
column4: U.S. accident investigators said on Monday.

column2: World Bank panel won't decide this year on request for Exxon-Venezuela award revision-lawyer CARACAS
column3: Dec 2 The World Bank's international arbitration panel will not decide this year whether to take up Venezuela's request for a revision of an award that ordered it to pay Exxon Mobil Corp in compensation for oil projects nationalized in 2007
column4: a lawyer for the country told Reuters on Tuesday.

column2: Stephen Hawking hails "life changing" speech upgrade LONDON
column3: Dec 2 Theoretical physicist Stephen Hawking can communicate with the world faster and easier thanks to new technology from Intel Corp and SwiftKey which replaces the decades-old platform that made his computerised voice recognisable around the world.

column2: IBM signs $1.25 bln WPP cloud deal and says more coming LONDON
column3: Dec 2 IBM is enjoying a wave of major technology outsourcing deals from European customers in the fourth quarter and the new contract signings are not over yet
column4: an executive for the computer sciences giant said in an interview.

column2: No serious side effects in Merck/Newlink Ebola vaccine testUPDATE 1-No serious side effects in Merck/Newlink Ebola vaccine test LONDON
column3: Dec 2 The first people vaccinated with an experimental Ebola shot being developed by Merck and NewLink have had no serious side effects so far
column4: but a few experienced mild fever
column5: Swiss researchers said on Tuesday.  UPDATE 1-No serious side effects in Merck/Newlink Ebola vaccine test LONDON

column2: China to crack down on tax avoidance by foreign firms - Xinhua SHANGHAI
column3: Dec 2 China will toughen its stance on tax avoidance by foreign firms to prevent tax payments being directed overseas
column4: the official Xinhua news agency has said
column5: after Beijing levied $140 million in back taxes from U.S. firm Microsoft Corp last week.

column2: Schlumberger to reduce seismic fleet Dec 2 Schlumberger Ltd
column3: the world's No.1 oilfield services provider
column4: said it was reducing the size of its marine seismic fleet
column5: as it expects customers to cut exploration spending.
